author: {'steamid': '76561198093108826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1699798945}
review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
[list]
[*]RTS with MOBA and CTF elements
[*]Has singleplayer but no campaign
[*]Has multiplayer but no players to play with
[/list]

[h1]Gameplay ★★☆☆☆[/h1]
[list]
[*]Perhaps the only noteworthy thing this game tries to do, is to bring some of the innovation of MOBAs back to its parent genre, the RTS.
[*]MOBAs ditched base building and focused on hero units. You get your base already built from the start, and units (minions) just stream out of your base for free. There are no hero units in Arena Wars 2, but you do get the rest.

[*]There are turrets in each lane to guard each player's base, just like a MOBA.
[*]Your base consists of a factory (called Headquarters) and a flag platform (called Launchpad) for playing CTF.

[*]The Headquarters spawns your units and also heals if you send them back to it. If enemies step inside, they will take constant damage until they die. Sounds just like the spawn platform in MOBAs. And did I mention that it is invulnerable?
[*]The Launchpad is where you will try to defend and prevent the enemy from taking the flag (called Module). If you successfully retrieve 3 modules back to your Launchpad, your rocket will fire off and nuke the enemy and you win.

[*]There are no infantry or barracks. All units in this game are vehicles (tanks and mechs). 
[*]There are no power plant, refinery or silos. The only resource in this game is player level, which determines the max amount of money you have, as well as upgrade points to upgrade your units.
[*]You gain XP by killing enemies or destroying XP camps littered across the map.
[*]Money comes easy — your wallet is already full from the beginning. You spend money to build units, and when they die, you get it back in full. When you level up and your wallet gets bigger, the extra space gets filled up with cash automatically.
[*]It's really just about budget management and buying the right thing for the right situation.

[*]As the all-seeing player with the bird's eye view, you get 2 items (read: Summoner Spells) that were pre-selected by you before the game begins. Item choices include haste, slow, heal, shield, and a bunch of RTS superweapons albeit smaller in scale. Such items are single-use only, but you can go around destroying camps on the map to collect more.
[*]As such, these camps provide points of contention for the players to skirmish and fight for control.
[*]There are also major camps called Power Cores each belonging to a player (but located far away from their base) that when destroyed will unleash a devastating shockwave around their Launchpad and destroy any of their units nearby. This is a mechanic to discourage full-on camping beside the flag.

[*]There is no singleplayer campaign, no story, no factions. You just pick a map and a bot difficulty, and off you go. There's not even a tutorial! You have to click the 'Help' button and read the short guide.
[/list]

[h1]Art & Graphics ★★★☆☆[/h1]
[list]
[*]The designs of the units and structures follow a uniform style, and they do look pretty good design-wise. The details are nice and quite detailed. It is a pity that there are no multiple factions and hence the art is too little to create any sense of variety.
[*]Graphics output of the Delta game engine matches the quality of StarCraft 2. This is by no means great by today's standards, but comparing 2 games released within the same timeframe, it holds up well against the reigning king of RTS in this regard.
[*]Animations are passable and I'm just glad to see no drifty movement. The walk cycles of the mechs do look convincing enough like they are really walking on the terrain.
[*]Effects like explosions and electric bolts use generic sprites and are not very interesting.
[/list]

[h1]Music & Sounds ★★☆☆☆[/h1]
[list]
[*]Generic electronic music with a minor epic feel.
[*] Passable voice lines. Soundbites from the units are processed to sound like voice comms. Announcer's voice has a slight echo treatment. The devs did the work, but it's nothing outstanding.
[*]Lack of death lines and sounds of machines falling apart is really obvious; there's just explosions.
[/list]

[h1]Plot & Characters ☆☆☆☆☆ 0/5[/h1]
[list]
[*]Absolutely nothing.
[/list]

[h1]Controls & Interface ☆☆☆☆☆ 0/5[/h1]
[list]
[*]The controls are remappable but opens up in notepad for you to edit. That's just lazy. And it didn't work anyway when I tried creating my own control scheme. Heck, even some of its own hotkeys don't work.
[*]*Attack-Move hotkey doesn't work.* 
[*]*Waypoint button doesn’t work.*
[/list]

[h1]Verdict [/h1]
[quote]A CTF RTS that tries to simplify the RTS macro by borrowing features from MOBA might sound like an interesting concept on paper. But in practice, MOBA is actually a poor fit for enhancing the idea of a CTF RTS. What RTS brings to CTF is base building — constructing an ironclad defense to guard the flag like never before seen. Removing the core of RTS while still forcing it to be played like one only ends up with a game that has no soul.[/quote]

[b][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198084877137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1560683256}
review:
Im Grunde genommen, ist Arena Wars 2 ein gut durchdachtes und sehr kurzweiliges Multiplayer-Strategiespiel. Das Problem liegt einzig und allein darin, dass es sich nur noch im Singleplayer gegen die KI spielen lässt und seinen Spielern auch keine Möglichkeit bereitstellt, einen eigenen Server zu eröffnen, um beispielsweise eine kleine Runde mit Freunden zu spielen.

Dadurch ist Arena Wars 2 jeglicher Existenzberechtigung beraubt und schlichtweg überflüssig geworden. Es lässt sich nicht einmal für Spieler empfehlen, die gerne Steam-Erfolge sammeln, da diese ebenfalls einen starken Multiplayer-Fokus haben und die meisten davon offline nicht zu erhalten sind.

[b]Pro:[/b]
- Gut ausbalancierte Einheiten

[b]Contra:[/b]
- Multiplayerspiel ohne Multiplayer = Todesurteil

[b]ARENA WARS 2:[/b] Sinnlos & überflüssig !

[b]Wertung:[/b] 5 / 10 Punkte

Das komplette Review gibt es hier zum nachlesen: https://www.bombanski.de/2019/12/08/arena-wars-2-pc-review/

author: {'steamid': '76561198055238509', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1470989310}
review:
Hab das Spiel damals günstig geholt und als RTS-Fan Starcraft/Warcraft und Co. dachte ich, dass das bestimmt zumindest ein paar Stunden Spaß macht.
Oh Boy, was lag ich falsch.
Ich hab vielleicht ne Stunde damit verbracht - meistens offline, deswegen ist die Spielzeit nicht mitgezählt. Und naja, danach hatte ich gefühlt alles vom Spiel gesehen. Das Spielsystem ist zwar schnell, aber alles andere als großartig komplex, die Grafik ist whack, das Setting ist langweilig, die Animationen sind lieblos, gutes Makro wird nicht belohnt, hier kommts ausschließlich auf Micromanagement an und das fühlt sich einfach nicht belohnend oder gut oder besonders tief an.
Aber das wäre alles nicht so dramatisch, wenn man es nicht nur gegen die leicht durchschaubare KI, sondern gegen menschliche Spieler spielen könnte - aber da niemand dieses Spiel spielt oder mag (schon vor 5 Jahren nicht), habt ihr da nicht viel von.
Absolut langweilig. Kann ich niemandem empfehlen, nicht einmal bei nem 95%-Sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059057015', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1590302011}
review:
우선 멀티 전용게임에서 서버가 내려갔다.
더욱 치명적인건 LAN을 지원하지 않아 랜멀티조차 불가능.
멀티 도전과제도 있어서 100% 클리어 조차도 불가능하다

게임 자체도 출시 당시 기준(2012)으로도 매우 시대착오적이다.
퀄리티도 2000년대 스타유즈맵 수준이며 종족도 단 1가지 뿐이다
아니다 그냥 유닛이 8개? 로 끝이다.
게임방식은 RTS를 표방하고있지만 미니언을 직접 생산하는 AOS에 가깝다
영웅이 없으니 플레이의 다양성은 오로지 맵으로만 결정된다.
블리자드의 유료유즈맵이 5000원대인걸 감안하면
그 퀄리티에도 한참 못미치는 조악한 이 겜에 4400원은 매우 비싸다
물론 틈만나면 80-90%대 할인을 하니 사실상 별 의미는 없지만.

매우 조악한 탓에 굳이 살필요도, 
심지어 번들에 딸려오더라도 플레이 할 이유조차 없다.

어차피 멀티가 안되니 게임 디자인으로만 평점을 메기자면
2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995498126', 'num_games_owned': 2366, 'num_reviews': 665, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1428753942}
review:
Also eigentlich ist das Spiel ja ganz ok und sicherlich für ne schnelle Runde zwischendurch auch durchaus empfehlenswert.
Ist Capture the Flag mit Einheiten als Strategiespiel.
Leider gibt es nicht so viele Maps und ist wohl immerr nur 1vs1 gegen die KI oder online.
Eine Kampagne gibt es nicht.
Man versucht also nur mit paar Einheiten auf den Karten vom Gegner die Tonnen zu klauen und ggf. unterwegs paar Bonusgegenstände einzusammeln.
Es fehlt also einiges, was den einen oder anderen sicherlich stört und dann langfristig auch nicht vor den Bildschirm fesseln kann oder wird.
Wer so eine Art MOBA ohne zusätzliche eigenständig agierende KI Mitstreiter sucht und mit 1vs 1 leben kann, bekomtm hier für sehr wenig Geld in den öfers vorkommenden Deals sicherlich einen guten Gegenwert geboten.
Die Garfik ist nett, bei mir hatten die Einheiten aber keine eigene Farbentextur, sondern waren alle weiß-silbern.
Ich habe eine Runde gegen die KI gewonnen, danach hatte ich aber ehrlich keine Lust, noch weiter zu spielen.
Dazu fehlen mir halt die oben angesprochenen Dinge.
Ist halt nur Durchschnitt, ohne interessante und motivierende Features, die mich fesseln würden.
Daher eher Daumen runter als hoch.

If you are bored of the standard RTS games on the market and are looking for something faster paced then you may want to check out Arena Wars 2. If you can't however, then this will be a short lived game for you.

review:
Как и многие, увидел на распродаже за небольшие деньги эту  "игру".  

 Покупал еще в том году, но осадок до сих пор остался, поэтому и решил написать этот обзор.

 Заманила она меня не только маленькой ценой, но и красивыми скриншотами, а так же достижениями. Да и в целом я люблю стратегии, хотелось что-то новое попробовать, но увы... На семерке "игра" так и не запустилась, а на на ХР вылетала каждую секунду после загрузочного экрана. Я долго матерился, но пытался запустить её снова и снова. Мне так и не удалось это сделать.

 Жажда наживы разрабов взяла свое, поэтому этот неработоспособный проект оказался здесь.И это очень печально. Ведь есть еще куча других проектов(в стиме и не только), разработчикам которых не хватает денег, чтобы выпустить свое творение, а груда недоработанных и  забагованных "игр" просто заполонила стим.

 Я толком не потратился, но и вам не рекомендую тратить даже рубль на этот шлак! И не запускается она у каждого второго, судя по обзорам других пользователей.

P.S. В прошлом году эта игра стоила 249 рублей. Сейчас цену на нее снизили, но баги не убрали. Грамотный ход маркетингов? Попытка увеличить продажи данной херни? Сбор пожертвований на испрвление кривизны рук разработчиков? 

Это пока остается загадкой...

review:
Игру рекомендую тем,кто очень не любит проигрывать и всегда это воспринимает близко к сердцу.Другим эта игра может и не понравится.Довольно скудная на элементы космическая стратегия,целью которой является воровство с территории противника трех элементов для запуска уничтожающей врага ракеты.5 уровней сложности и я вас уверяю-уже с 3 уровня начнутся определенные сложности.10 уровней прокачки,которые можно использовать для апгрейда роботов или увеличения их числа(количество или качество-выбирать вам).

Крайне важное значение имеют специальные сооружения на карте,при уничтожении которых увеличивается прокачка и появляется возможность апгрейда.Таким образом необходимо не только охранять свою территорию,но не забывать уничтожать нейтральные здания быстрее противника.Ну а когда на высоком уровне идешь в атаку-враг тут же успешно ворует элементы для запуска ракеты и пока не вернешь этот элемент,то не сможешь сворованный разместить у себя на базе.


Вообщем простенько,но со вкусом.Когда отхватываешь люлей от компа,то начинаешь злиться и игра становится интересной.Вот такие дела.

review:
Même à moins d'un euro, ça vaut pas le coup...

Le gameplay en carton dans des arenes toutes moches, chaque joueurs fait apparaitre des unités dans sa base et doit aller piquer des drapeaux dans la base ennemis puis les ramener pour scorer.  

Ouais mais on me dira que les amateurs de moba ou de rts peuvent trouver leur compte, bah nan oubliez...

Le joueur peut aller jusqu'au lvl 10 dans une partie, pouvant ainsi upgrade jusqu'a 2 fois les unité ou alors son supply
Il y'a des item a recupérer sur la map en detruisant des depot a endroit fixe. (bombe, vitesse, heal, defense, etc)
Les arênes se ressemblent toutes.

Donc au final, vous ferrez toujours la même chose...
S'adapter a son adversaire en mode online ? Je pense pas qu'un jour quelqu'un ait deja trouvé un adversaire... plus de 10min d attente sans succes. 
Et le mode solo est sans intéret avec ces 5 pseudo niveaux de difficulté

Mauvais !

review:
I get where they are coming from when it comes to trying to make an arena based strategy game. 

If you like pulling apart arena games and enjoy trying new ones now and then. (Yikes I know you have invested so much time learning the current ones).

On the plus side after playing with the settings I was able to try this game I grabbed in a sale some time ago for 99c.

What I liked: 
* Control over the entire battlefield
* Ability to mix and match units when you need to.
* Upgrading to your unit strategy. Though the towers lend themselves to only a few winning strats.

What I was not so keen on:
* Farming power ups and XP on the sides took away some of the promise of "Fast Paced" promise. 
* Generator concusion blast is too strong. Something that does less damage would be fine, or at least draw out the concussion line around the base so defenses can be set accordingly. 
* Unit roles are not diverse enough to stop what would inevitably be a battle of attrition. (Whoever upgrades the Destroyers first will take out the turrets and eventually win)
* No creeps do make the game seem "Quiet" now and then unless you are taking the action to the other player.

review:
Well, I bought it for $0.79, and it seemed nice in the screenshots and videos. I also read a couple of positive reviews.
When I first launched the game, the intro videos and menu were very sluggish, so I checked the video option and lowered the resolution. Guess what? That didn't help at all, it was still sluggish.
I continued to start a game, and here I was lost. There is no indication on how to play this, no objectives, no tutorial or gameplay guide. You have to figure out what every UI element, unit and building does. When I finally figured out how to start, well the game is not fun. After two or three rounds I was bored. And of course, the game was sluggish during gameplay as it was in the game menu, no matter what resolution I chose.
The UI is horrible, too big and no way to scale it down. There's no way to zoom out the map, you only see a small portion of it. I found no way to center the screen on a unit or group of units, or to have the camera follow the units.
I regret I bought this game, even if it was only $0.79

review:
To recommend or not... well at this -90% price YES. I've spend some minutes with this game and it feels like the first one... but it lacks stuff. A LOT OF STUFF. As far as I can see, there's only one game mode, where Arena Wars 1 offered few more, like bombing run and domination. Units are still the same, developer(s) have put some effort to create one more upgrade possibility. In AW1 you could only upgrade one unit by sacrificin it to a upgrade tower and then that unit was upgraded and so on... this level system seems to be interesting (so far, only few minutes in).

I bought 4 copies: 1 for myself and 3 for friends. I bet we are going to have fun with this... or then we are going to cry our eyes out, can't say yet. There's plenty of options to play your game since possibilities are endless... until you find "the one and only" way to play each level.

I've heard some people have had problems even launching this game. I haven't got any problems with that, so it seems to be totally random, depending on your current rig. Great! It can feel a bit slow (it is actually kinda slow) but... I dunno. Take your friends with you and give it a go.

review: While the singleplayer side of things seems dim and underdeveloped the multiplayer with friends is a huge blast. 1v1 can bring 2 hour wars of attrition or quick sweeps with rush builds that either get crushed with well-thought defense placements or heavy investment for the countering unit(s). Many people are bashing this game for the lack of depth and while the game certainly does lack depth, it can teach a deep appreciation for rts games with it's handful of interesting mechanics to even someone like me who has never touched many rts. review:
Please read before judging me for a negative review.

First of all, I never actually got to play my copy of the game.  All hardware requirements were exceeded, let alone met, yet it would literally never finish loading, always crashing around 80%.

I got to a friend's house and he had it on his computer.  So I told him about my problem, and he allowed me to play his.  It worked on his, in case you couldn't guess.  The gameplay did keep me busy, which is really all I ask for in a game, but it just failed to meet my expectations.

The level designs weren't really creative, the combat is a little dull, and the controls and actions were...  Anyway, if you need something to pass the time, this should meet that requirement.  I bought it when it was on sale for $1, and for the price, I would say it was worth it (if it did work, but I won't judge it based on that).  Would I buy it at full price?  Never.  Would I play it if it worked?  Probably.  I don't have any other RTS or Strategy games.

My final review- Dull, yet passes the time.  5.2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971287511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1386641901}
review:
I saw this on sale for 99 cents and when a game is that cheap, unless the offends your ancestors in some deep and unforgivable way, you buy it. I, like many others on steam, bought this simply because it's this cheap. The 90% off sale is the "we're not making any more money from this" sale last ditch attempt to produce some revenue from a title.  Considering I haven't heard of this rather generic looking, what appears to be some sort of RTS game, I wasn't expecting much and I wasn't surprised in so many ways. 

Arena Wars 2 is a top down real-time strategy game that pits you against a player or an AI component in what is essentially a match of capture the flag. This is a "first-impression" review as I am honestly unwilling to put more than the hour and 20 minutes I put into this game. The gameplay is very mediocre and the units in the game are fairly uninspired. The game seems to be a "rock paper scissors" game in the sense that one unit is clearly designed to defeat another particular unit. Unfortunately this concept I felt was implented poorly as one unit will do more damage to another unit seemingly abritrarily and it lacks the thougthfulness of a mature RTS game. 

There is no tutorial or any intro missions to introduce each of the mechanics so the player is thrown in to engage in a trail and error process of figuring everything out. 

To this game's merit, I do like the idea. This game is designed to get he player in the action right away and matches will end quickly whereas a full RTS game might include 2 hours of base-building prior to any combat. A match or two of this game could be played on a lunch break.

This game is an online game but seeing how this game doesn't have a consistent playerbase this is effectively a single player game. There are several difficulty levels and in my first hour and 20 minutes it took getting to the hardest difficulty level to experience any sort of challenge. One very annoying aspect is that these difficulty levels need to be unlocked *per level* and there are five of them. This means that for each level I want to play on, I need to suffer through four matches of boring before I get to the very average gameplay.

I noticed a bug where an area-of-effect ability hits the wreck of a tower it will register damage and repeat "Turret destroyed" - there may be more bugs but finding this so readily underlines this game's overall lack of polish.



The idea has some merit but I cannot recommend this title for any price. The real cost of a game your own freetime anyway.
Score 4/10

review: Игра для начинающих, и тех кто основательно подзабыл мир современных техногенных стратегий. При сохранении основных признаков хедлайнеров, все что можно - в геймплее упрощено. За счет этого не надо вникать как сделать очередной апгрейд ногтя целителя помошника командоса группы трупперов, и тому подобные апгрейды. Дюжина специальных способностей в геймплее Arena Wars 2 при этом присутствует, и все очень классично: бомбежка, ион-бим, щит и прочие радости. В настройках игры радует изменение скорости геймплея. Имеется 10 карт для сражений на выбор (формата супер-микро), 5 видов юнитов, 3 степени апгрейда для каждого вида, 5 видов строений, включая оборонительные башни. Отсутсвие возможности что либо построить превращают игру в "захват флага" в роли которого выступают особые бочонки на площадке запуска ракеты. Захватил 3 бочонка и Ура! - Ваша ракета готова размазать базу противника и принести победу!
